summary:
I am a medical doctor with an interest in pulmonary-vascular/cardiovascular medicine, critical (intensive) care, and internal medicine. 
My aim is to contribute to better outcomes for patients by ‘bench to bedside’ (translational) research and by providing excellent patient care. I have ‘wet lab’ and ‘dry lab’ research experience; amongst others in the fields of iron metabolism, pulmonary arterial hypertension, sepsis, and COVID-19. 
In October 2023, I will start as PhD candidate at the University of Cambridge’s Heart and Lung Research Institute, funded by the Gates Cambridge Trust.

projects:
[{'title': 'Biological Response Score', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'We preformed a literature study after which we determined SNPs related to a good or a bad response to TNF-alpha inhibitors in RA (pharmacogenetics). 
We used these SNPs to create a formula which migth predict the response to TNF-alpha inhibitors in patients with RA. We accounted for the association between the SNPs and the clinical effect, the pathway in which the SNP was situated, and the quality of the study (by using the NOS and AMSTAR scale). 

During this project I cooperated with Niels Pouw, Sydney van Tienoven, Mark Onderstal and Carine Angelino (all BSc-students in medicine).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eckart', 'last_name': 'de Bie', 'name': None, 'headline': 'MD, MPhil | Junior Doctor - Cardiology '}]}]
